text: everyone today I'm making one Oh is the
sticky rice dumplings with pork and mung
beans feelings the concept of these
dumplings are quite similar to the
Vietnamese traditional rice cakes called
punching and Bantam but it's wrapped in
a kind of pyramid shape and in a much
smaller size so you can basically have
the similar taste to Bandung and Monday
but it'd take less time to cook and so
you can easily make it at home let's
begin firstly you want to wash sticky
rice a few times until the water runs
clear and then soaked in water for at
least four hours also wash a hundred
gram up you split mung beans and then
soak in water for one hour the things
will grow bigger and then we're going to
cook in a rice cooker with about a cup
of water if you don't have a rice cooker
you can steam the beans until they are
soft for about 20 minutes then mash the
mung beans with a wooden spoon or pull
in a processor with a teaspoon of sugar
and half a teaspoon of salt
you also need hundred fifty gram about
five hours of potbelly cut into about
one centimeter thick slices and then
we're going to season the meat with a
tablespoons of minced shallots and some
salt and pepper to taste mix well and
set aside for about 15 minutes next
scoop about a tablespoon of the mash
more beans and press it out into a thin
disc then place a piece of the pork into
the center then compress and shape it
into a rough ball
after soaking the sticky rice in water
for at least four hours or overnight you
want to drain well and then toss with
half a teaspoon of salt you want to tear
the banana leaf into large square pieces
about 20 by 20 centimeters then quickly
blanch in boiling water so it's easier
to work with and also to sterilize place
one piece on another with the dark side
facing outwards put your party finger
somewhere into the center a bit lower
and then fold into triangle and then you
can open it up into a full now
now place three tablespoons of the
sticky rice into the burner and make a
hole in the center then place a feeling'
bar into it and then cover it up with
about one to two tablespoons of more
sticky rice when all has to be shaped
into color pyramid shape which has four
jobs putting out so just watch carefully
to see how it's done make sure that you
wrap and tuck it in carefully and do not
make any leak because if the water
penetrates into the dumplings the
dumplings going to be very mushy then
you can use some kitchen toys to tie it
up you want to tie the two jobs first
and twist the cake at the 90 degrees and
then tie one more knot now let me do
another one
you
then you want to gather all the
dumplings together and tie them up just
like that trim off the excess strings if
any now you want to cook the dumplings
for about three hours if you use normal
pot and about one hour and a half if you
use the pressure cooker one thing you
have to make sure is that the water
should be cover the dumplings the whole
time so use something heavy like a plate
to press it down making sure the
dumplings well submerge into the water
if you use a normal pot you probably
have to top it up with more hot water
during the cooking process when it's
done you can wring the dumplings under
cold water then hang them up to dry
completely well I'm so excited not sure
how it is inside look at that the inside
is fully cooked and not mushy at all you
can see clearly the mung beans fueling
and the pork showing up it looks so good
I really enjoy a pan Oh with some soy
sauce and chili sauce yummy I hope you
like it and don't forget to click like
and subscribe check out my Vietnamese
button playlists and also more ideas for
the upcoming Ted holiday thank you for
watching bye bye
